Nope, not a peep, can't say I'm surprised. And the fourth and final big problem that this generator cannot exist. The first law of thermodynamics states energy cannot be created nor destroyed, but it can be transferred. Let's use the DIY generator motor device we saw earlier. We'll simplify it to two wheels and a belt. Let's pretend we're in a perfect magical world with no energy waste and 100% efficiency. If I use my finger to spin the left wheel, transferring potential energy from my finger to kinetic energy in the wheel, that wheel would spin forever and the belt would move with it spinning the other wheel also forever. In this case, 100% of the energy I transferred to the system is being outputted. But in reality, this is impossible. The output energy cannot be equal to the input let alone exceed it like these scammers imply. The output energy will always be less than the input. This is why motors typically have an efficiency rating, to let the user know how much energy is doing real work. But why does this happen? In our example, the wheel experiences friction as it grinds against the axle, which holds it in place. When this occurs, heat and sound energy are transferred to the surrounding environment leaving less energy to spin the wheel. This energy loss also happens on the right wheel. In addition, the belt also experiences friction as it rubs against both wheels which also transfers energy to the environment. This is why shortly after I remove my finger the wheels won't spin very long. So if these simple wheels can't keep themselves spinning there's no way a generator can supply its own power and power your home simultaneously. It is 100% impossible. The scammers waste your time with a 20 minute sales video. Then they waste your money with a $49 ebook, then they waste even more of your time and money enticing you to create a generator which can't even possibly exist in the known universe.
